intro: Lepidaploa costanensis, commonly known as the Costanense Lepidaploa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are small and white or pale yellow. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
